intro: Stenogyne wilkesii, commonly known as the Wilkes' ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and sturdy, woody stems. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale blue, arranged in clusters. It thrives in coastal and mesic habitats, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its ecological importance and limited distribution, Stenogyne wilkesii is considered a rare and endangered species.
